abstract: Joe Drape On Boxing column argues that while long-anticipated bout between Floyd Mayweather Jr and Manny Pacquiao is expected to generate record viewership and revenue, sport of boxing itself is showing signs of serious decline; observes that recent heavyweight title defense by Wladimir Klitschko failed to sell out Madison Square Garden, far cry from era in which boxing regularly made front page headlines.
lead_paragraph: Saturday’s bout between Floyd Mayweather Jr. and Manny Pacquiao could generate a billion dollars, but the epitaph for the sport has been written in larger and larger type over the past decades.

headline.main: Mayweather-Pacquiao Is an Easy Sell; Boxing Isn’t
headline.print_headline: This Fight’s an Easy Sell; the Sport Isn’t

snippet: Saturday’s bout between Floyd Mayweather Jr. and Manny Pacquiao could generate a billion dollars, but the epitaph for the sport has been written in larger and larger type over the past decades.
